Topic: Afro Latinx Religions and Social Cultures of Resistance in the Americas and the Caribbean


This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement: - Region. 
This course analyzes the contemporary (twentieth-twenty-first centuries) cultural developments in which African religions have influenced North America, South America, and the Caribbean. Topics of special interests are going to consider how African thought have influenced the sense of a cultural resistance and subversion in Argentina, Brazil, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Puerto Rico, the United States, Uruguay, and Venezuela. Our examination will consider the intersections of Ethics, Spirituality, and Culture, focusing on the emergence of critical thought in philosophical writings, also in cultural and religious manifestations such as Candombe, Candombl√©, and Mardi-Gras, as well as performative and visual arts in these aforementioned nations.
